home.title: We’re getting married!
home.intro: We are so excited to celebrate our special day with you in beautiful Murcia, Spain! Your presence would mean the world to us. We cannot wait to celebrate our love surrounded by cherished family and friends from all around the world.
home.intro2: We cannot wait to celebrate our love surrounded by cherished family and friends from all around the world.

travel&stay.title: Travel & Stay
travel&stay.subtitle: your travel guide
travel&stay.text: We know many of you will be traveling to come celebrate, here are some lodging recs & travel tips!

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.subtitle: what’s Happening
schedule.dresscode: We kindly ask guests to dress in semi-formal attire. Suits and ties, dresses and generally elegant outfits are encouraged. It’s not a black-tie event, so no need for tuxedos or floor-length gowns — but we’d love everyone to feel dressed up for the occasion. Please refrain from wearing white or white-adjacent colours. Since the celebration will be outdoors in the Spanish sunshine, lighter fabrics and bright colours are encouraged. If choosing to wear heels, you may wish to choose wedges or block heels instead of stilettos.

guests.children: We love your little ones, but our wedding will be for adults and teens only. We kindly ask that toddlers and small infants sit this one out — partly because of venue rules, and partly so everyone can eat, drink, and dance without worrying about naptimes!
guests.plusOnes: We have set up the RSVP so that one person per party can fill it in. Please note wedding invitations are only extended to established couples, and single people are not allowed a plus one.

story.title: Our Story
story.subtitle: 10 years, forever to go
story.text: It all started with an unexpected match. She was looking for inspiration for her next trip; he was looking for someone who wasn't afraid to sing at the top of their lungs in the car.
story.text2: One autumn afternoon, amid laughter, coffee and a playlist that continues to grow, they discovered they shared much more than favourite songs.

travel.title: Travel & Stay
travel.subtitle: if you want to go directly to each section, click on the stamp you want to explore

getting.title: Getting to Murcia
getting.paragraph1: Murcia is easily reached from the UK, with regular flights from many airports. The nearest airport is Región de Murcia International (RMU), about 30 minutes from the city. Alicante airport (ALC) is also a great option, about an hour away.
getting.paragraph2: For those travelling from outside of Europe, the easiest route is to fly to Madrid’s Adolfo Suárez Madrid–Barajas Airport; from here, you can get a train or a flight to Murcia.
getting.paragraph3: To check the best combination for you, please have a look at routes on Skyscanner.

airports.title: airports
airports.subtitle: how to get to Murcia from different airports?
airports.paragraph2: For those travelling from outside of Europe, the easiest route is to fly to Madrid’s Adolfo Suárez Madrid–Barajas Airport; from here, you can get a train or a flight to Murcia.
airports.paragraph3: To check the best combination for you, please have a look at routes on Skyscanner.

rmU.title: Región de Murcia International Airport (RMU)
rmU.text1: The closest airport to Murcia, about 30 minutes away by car.
rmU.text2: From the airport, you can take a taxi or use a car hire service to reach the city center.

alc.title: Alicante Airport (ALC)
alc.text1: About an hour away from Murcia by car.
alc.text2: From Alicante Airport, you can take a bus, train, or taxi to Murcia.

accordion.carTxt: These are some car rental companies that are available from or nearby
accordion.clickGoogle: Click to view on Google Map

accommodation.title: accommodation
accommodation.subtitle: our recommended accommodation for your comfort
accommodation.paragraph1: We recommend staying near the city center. A bus will run to and from the wedding, making it easy to get back after the celebration.
accommodation.paragraph2: Here are some of our favorite hotels in Murcia.

taxi.title: taxis
taxi.text1: Taxis and Ubers are available in Murcia, although Uber is not that popular in the city, so availability might be more limited.
taxi.text2: Taxis can be booked on the Pidetaxi app.

carhire.title: car hire
carhire.text1: If you’re planning to explore beyond Murcia, hiring a car is the easiest way.
carhire.text2: Please see the airports section for links of different car rental options.

walking.title: walking
walking.text1: Murcia is a very walkable city, with many attractions, restaurants, and shops within easy reach of each other.

public.title: public transport
public.text1: Murcia has a reliable bus network that connects different parts of the city. You can buy tickets on board or at kiosks.

weather.title: weather
weather.subtitle: quick climate guide so you can come prepared.
weather.text1: Late May in Murcia is the turning point from spring into full blown Summer. Expect it to be warm!
weather.text2: For the days, bring your SPF and light clothes for your off days and enjoy basking in the Sun!
weather.text3: Evenings may be slightly cooler, so do bring something long sleeved, but you can leave your woolly jumpers at home!

tips.title: travel tips
tips.subtitle: essential tips to make your experience perfect
tips.text1: Late May in Murcia is the turning point from spring into full blown Summer. Expect it to be warm!
tips.text2: For the days, bring your SPF and light clothes for your off days and enjoy basking in the Sun!
tips.text3: Evenings may be slightly cooler, so do bring something long sleeved, but you can leave your woolly jumpers at home!

language.title: language
language.text1: The official language in Murcia is Spanish. While many people in the tourism industry speak English, it’s helpful to know some basic Spanish phrases to enhance your experience.

food.title: food & drink
food.text1: Murcia is known for its delicious cuisine, including fresh seafood, tapas, and local specialties like zarangollo and pastel de carne. Don’t forget to try the local wines and sangria!

explore.title: explore murcia
explore.subtitle: essential tips to make your experience perfect
explore.text1: Murcia is more than just sunshine and sangria (though there’s plenty of both!).
explore.text2: If you’re staying a few days, here is a map with some of our favourite places to eat, drink, and explore.

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.subtitle: you have questions, we have answers

q1.question: Where can I confirm my attendance?
q1.answer: All RSVPs are done online (scroll up a bit and click the big RSVP button), but if you have trouble with the form, please contact Alex or Maria.

q2.question: What date should I RSVP by?

q3.question: What is the weather like in the area?
q3.answer: The weather during the month of May is usually beautiful! Depending on if summer stays around it may be in the low to mid 70s, but then cool off nicely at night (50s-60s). The average temp is around 65 and sunny. We don't expect rain, but we'll always be prepared!

q4.question: Can children come?
q4.answer: We love your little ones, but our wedding will be for adults and teenagers only. We kindly ask that young children not attend, partly due to venue rules and partly so that everyone can eat, drink, and dance without worrying about nap times.

q5.question: Dress Code & Outfit Tips
q5.answer: We kindly ask guests to dress in semi-formal attire. Suits and ties, dresses and generally elegant outfits are encouraged. It’s not a black-tie event, so no need for tuxedos or floor-length gowns — but we’d love everyone to feel dressed up for the occasion. Please refrain from wearing white or white-adjacent colours. Since the celebration will be outdoors in the Spanish sunshine, lighter fabrics and bright colours are encouraged. If choosing to wear heels, you may wish to choose wedges or block heels instead of stilettos.

question.attending: Will you be attending our wedding?
question.bus: Will you need the bus service?
question.partner: Will you be bringing a plus-one?

final.attendingText: We can't wait to celebrate with you!
final.thanksNotAttending: Thank you for letting us know!
final.notAttendingText: Even though you can't join us, we will be thinking of you on our special day

modal.errorText2: Please try again in a few moments
modal.errorText3: If the problem persists, feel free to contact the couple directly.

footer.text: Come hang with us in Murcia!
